original_title: Sri Lanka requests banks to re-structure loans of SMEs, wage earners, pensioners
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s central bank has requested banks, finance and leasing companies to help re-structure loans of small and medium enterprises, wage earners and pensioners who are facing difficulties, Deputy Central Bank Governor Yvette Fernando said.

Small companies are facing higher interest rates and a downturn in demand following a currency collapse while wage earners and pensioners are facing lower disposable incomes as overall prices went up.
Some higher income earners have also been hit by severe socialist-style progressive income tax under IMF pressure.

“The Governor has made a request from banks, finance and leasing companies to look into the repayment capacity of small and medium enterprises, wage earners and pensioners who have monthly income and do an objective assessment,” Fernando said.
“After assessing the repayment capacity, to restructure the loans. That has been made as a request. We will shortly place an advertisement to educated the public.”

The central bank is also struggling to maintain the stability of the banking system, following the currency collapse. Bank in the last quarter have reported large margins after interest rate shot, but most of the money has also been used up provisions. (Colombo/Mar07/2023)
